name: Rak'tar
startIntroPart1: The Rak'tar Swarm was one of the first minds to emerge on the surface of Vartrex Prime, where it quickly proved its worth, wiping out lineages and devouring hives wherever they went. Their strength lies in their ability to produce massive swarms that are easily capable of outpowering less combat-oriented hives, yet the basal nature of their mind makes it almost impossible for them to adopt new thought processes.
startIntroPart2: Will you, great and mighty Swarmlord, epicentre of the Rak'tar hive, bring your hive to feast upon the weak? Will you build a hive that stands the test of time?
defeated: Prey too strong for Rak'tar... our hunger cannot be satiated now...
introduction: Prey speaks...? Is futile... Rak'tar grow hungry...
neutralYes: Prey is weak... we will exploit...
afterPeace: Prey strong... we grow before next hunt...
uniques: [-1 Culture] per [1] population in all cities

name: Kezit
startIntroPart1: The Kezit Overmind was one of the first minds to emerge on the surface of Vartrex Prime. It evolved at an unprecendented rate, quickly mastering its environment before turning its gaze upon the stars. Their strength lies in their enhanced synaptic web, which allows the hive mind to flawlessly gather information from its drones. The only downside to this trait is that drones that are separated from the main hive quickly grow uneasy due to the sudden lack of guidance.
startIntroPart2: Will you, as the Overmind of Kezit, bring your hive to the stars? Will you build a hive that stands the test of time?
attacked: Our mind is strong. We will fight back.
introduction: We are Kezit. We are legion.
neutralNo: What you seek we cannot provide.
neutralYes: This would be beneficial to the Overmind.
hateNo: What you seek we cannot provide.
hateYes: This would be beneficial to the Overmind.
afterPeace: We cannot continue this clash any longer.
tradeRequest: Does this seem fit to your mind?
uniques: [+1 Science] per [1] population in all cities
Unhappiness from number of Cities doubled

name: Int'uu
startIntroPart1: The Int'uu Collective was one of the first minds to emerge on the surface of Vartrex Prime. While its drones grew slower than the other minds of its time, its true strength laid in its highly introspective nature. Where other minds took to warfare and evolution to outpace each other, the Int'uu Collective kept to itself, growing powerful psionic capabilities and cultivating its own synapses, often to the detriment of its drones. The Mind's primitive instincts of selfishness lead it to utilize a single 'Queen' as its focal point, which proved to be a fatal weakness...
startIntroPart2: Will you, as the Int'uu Collective, bring your mind to true perfection? Will you build a hive that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: We cannot afford to leave you be any longer.
introduction: We are Int'uu; the closest to perfection. Can do your synapses register our presence?
hateHello: Imperfection has again come to stain our hive.
tradeRequest: Does this seem fit to your mind?
uniques: [+1 Culture] per [1] population in all cities
+[100]% Strength if within [5] tiles of a [Pheromone Nexus]
+[20]% Strength if within [1] tiles of a [Pheromone Node]

name: Tsan'tai
startIntroPart1: The Tsan'tai Unity was one of the first minds to emerge on the surface of Vartrex Prime. It was distinctive and bold, making decisions that most hives rarely did. Its reckless nature was not it's most defining feature, however; it was its nuturing and friendly nature that made it unique among the early hives. Whenever it encountered another mind, it would attempt to form a symbiotic link with it, though this behavior rarely succeeded immediately. The Tsan'tai gained many allies in the form of smaller, less dominant hives, which it would nurture and grow in exchange for its continued support. This tactic made the Unity and its allies nigh untouchable by other hives, but it ultimately took up too much resources and eventually led the mind into its own extinction.
startIntroPart2: Will you, as the Tsan'tai Unity, bring the world to purity and peace? Will you build a hive that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: Your actions have left us with one option: assimilation. Prepare yourselves.
attacked: Fighting is pointless; you will only lose resources for attacking us.
defeated: We are defeated. Your mind is strong.
introduction: We are Tsan'tai. Our mind is pure, and we seek only to improve this world. Do you go with the winds, or against them?
neutralLetsHearIt: We shall listen; you shall be heard.
neutralNo: We do not wish to quarrel, but this will not suffice.
neutralYes: We have reached an agreement; your offer will suffice.
hateHello: Your mind is impure. Perhaps we can redeem you yet...
afterPeace: We do not wish to fight any longer. Peace is the only option.
tradeRequest: The winds blow in your direction. Are you with them, or against?
uniques: 67% chance to earn 25 Gold and recruit a Barbarian unit from a conquered encampment
50% chance of capturing defeated Barbarian naval units and earning 25 Gold
[+1 Happiness, +1 Gold] per [2] population in all cities

name: Sekari
declaringWar: Sea is home. Protect at all costs.
attacked: Enemy seeks to kill Sekari. We will not fall.
defeated: Sekari sees its end. Enemy truly is strong.

name: Kator
declaringWar: We wait. We watch. Now, we feast.
attacked: You are no predator to us. We are strong.
defeated: Perhaps our foe is stronger than we imagined.

name: Venix
declaringWar: Your existence is a threat to our mind.
The barrier between us and the spirit world is frail, and we must ensure it does not weaken any further. For that, there must be sacrifice.
defeated: You've earned your feast, but at what cost?
uniques: Earn [100]% of [military] opponent's [Strength] as [Culture] for kills

name: Zyxia
attacked: I see. Coexistence is futile, then.
defeated: We wished for simple coexistence. Your hunger is too great to allow for that.
uniques: [+2 Culture, +2 Happiness] from each Trade Route
